snippet: The counteroffensive, which includes a new website, began even before the Senate committee issued its report on the agency’s harsh treatment of detainees.
abstract: Former Central Intelligence Agency Dir George J Tenet has been working for months with former CIA directors Porter Goss and Michael Hayden to rebut Senate Intelligence Committee's report on agency's interrogation tactics after 9/11 terrorist attacks; Tenet served from 1997 to 2004, under Presidents Bill Clinton and George W Bush, and led the agency in wake of 9/11 attacks during most intense phase of interrogations.

byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and ERIC LICHTBLAU

lead_paragraph: The counteroffensive, which includes a new website, began even before the Senate committee issued its report on the agency’s harsh treatment of detainees.

headline.main: Ex-Chief Leads Vocal Defense of C.I.A.
headline.print_headline: Ex-Chief Leads Vocal Defense of Spy Agency
